intro: Sterculia clemensiae, commonly known as the Kauri tree, is a large evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of northeastern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its massive, buttressed roots and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces showy, cream-colored flowers that are followed by woody, three-lobed capsules containing numerous seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to its size and longevity, it is a significant component of the rainforest ecosystem.
